programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Boss James Constantinou and the team appraise more items brought along by members of the public. A divorcee from Newcastle wants to sell her £185,000 necklace to pay for her children's private-school fees, a crystal-covered drum kit used on a Kylie Minogue tour catches the eye of staff member Patrick, and a widowed pensioner hopes to make a fortune from her precious rings. Plus, a valuation doesn't come easy to the experts when a client turns up with a 7ft Terminator model.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A couple search for a home big enough for them and their eight children in Alicante, and the agency takes on a huge property that includes a luxurious cat hotel in the basement.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert transforms a cottage in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, with dated decor, a bare kitchen and a garden that resembles a jungle.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Greg Miller, CEO of the Larry H Miller Group of Companies and co-owner of National Basketball Association team the Utah Jazz, goes undercover. Since his dad died he has made many changes to the organisation, and posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition to win a dream job, he works among his own staff to see if his father's legacy still lives on.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: The CEO and chairman of in-store media provider Mood Media, Lorne Abony, goes undercover in one of the fastest growing companies in America. Adopting a disguise in his own business, he finds out how efficiently it is functioning.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Triathletes Ron and Mel plan to sell their family home and buy two new properties with the proceeds. The pair look for a small house in the area of Kent where they already live and a ski chalet in the Les Gets area of France, where they want to enjoy winter and summer sports with friends and family.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from the north east of England compete for the £1,000 prize - first up are loved-up musicians Nick and Kelly, followed by Matthew and Katie, and Michael and Becky.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In north London, recently engaged couple Anita and Cash, laughter-loving Keith and his wife Maz, and foodies Dan and Les compete for the cash prize of £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to West Nyack, New York, to come to the aid of a family-run Mexican restaurant that is suffering a financial crisis, and a case of hard-headed patriarchy. When the chef arrives he finds himself turfing out the existing customers for their own safety due to a cockroach infestation on the premises.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Babylon in New York, where the peace of Long Island is regularly shattered by the volatile Pellegrino family, proprietors of Peter's Italian Restaurant. Gordon finds owner Tina's work to save the eatery from oblivion is frequently ruined by the behaviour of her brother, a tyrannical front-of-house manager whose violent temper constantly undermines staff morale.(n)

programme.title: Great British Buildings: Restoration of the Year
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud and Anna Keay present buildings in the Early category - those constructed between the 13th and 16th centuries. Those in the running are Hampton Court Palace, the Royal Hospital in Chelsea, a medieval building in Ledbury, and Hardwick Hall in Derbyshire, where the previously derelict stable block and barns have been revitalised for modern use. At the end of the programme, it is revealed which buildings have been chosen to make the final shortlist.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Mr Parsons the chameleon meets a new partner, Daphne from Paris. Jaguars Napo and Goshi are being encouraged to mate, but Napo doesn't seem to be romantically inclined. Meanwhile, young giraffe Murchison faces the great outdoors for the first time, and another baby elephant is born, less than a month after the last new arrival.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Thirty-year-old Chris is admitted after sustaining a potentially life-threatening wound during a game with his friend Jack, who fired the inside shaft of a ballpoint pen into his abdomen using an air rifle. College student Lennon has injured his head after jumping into a door frame while kicking a balloon, while 74-year-old Stafford arrives at A&E because his internal cardiac defibrillator keeps shocking him.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Billy is rushed to St George's after being crushed by falling bricks that were being stored on his front drive, while six-year-old Luther has a metal washer stuck on his finger. Senior healthcare play specialist Tracy talks about her job, which is to comfort and distract children during their treatment in A&E, and 83-year-old Audrey arrives with her grandson Lee after damaging her wrist while falling on holiday.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, two landlords rush to the scene of a police raid, where the occupant has turned their property into a large cannabis factory. Meanwhile, when the local council holds up their housing benefit claims in Doncaster, an agent decides to evict all of his 160 benefit tenants.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the complications of bereavement in the Rockland community. Melinda and Anazella's husband Jim recently died of cancer. His dying wish was for his brother Abel to marry his two widows and bring up his seven children - but Abel has three wives already, and the prospect of further upheaval is daunting for them. Although Jim's death has united Melinda and Anazella in grief, they must now choose whether to stay together as a family and risk living through the heartache of plural marriage again, or go their own way.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Opinionated TV viewers share their critiques of Kitchen 999: Emergency Chefs, the final of The Voice, Alone with the In-Laws, Line of Duty, Life Story, One Born Every Minute and the News.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Kat Cole goes undercover among the workforce of her company Cinnabon Incorporated, which serves sweet treats from more than 900 bakeries in 40 countries worldwide. Kat has come a long way after being raised by a single mother who fed her family of three girls on $10 a week. She seeks advice from her old boss, former Hooters CEO Coby Brooks, who also went undercover, in his own organisation. Kat has some lofty goals for Cinnabon to become a worldwide food brand, and wants to make sure that the new products she has put in place are working before she implements her plans.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Stephen J Cloobeck, chairman and CEO of hotel company Diamond Resorts International, becomes the first boss to go incognito at his own organisation for a second time.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Prohibition Grille in Everett, Washington, where he meets belly dancer-turned-restaurateur Rishi Brown, who is making all the wrong moves with her business. Distracted from the task of improving her menu by performing for customers, she's oblivious to the disastrous dishes being served from her own kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou mixes business with pleasure as he heads to Spain to meet an entrepreneur friend who's looking to get a £100,000 loan on his luxury 18-metre yacht. A young widow finds it difficult to part with her late husband's vintage car to set up a new life in Croatia, jewellery expert Monika is shocked when she's asked to deal with a golden rat, and the shop staff struggle to put a price on some rare and problematic black coral statues.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: South African couple Gary and Dawn are seeking a permanent home in Spain, with plenty of outdoor space for a barbecue, while art consultant Amy wants a holiday home in Almeria.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert visits the Wirral, where Dave and Gemma's five-bedroom semi-detached home looks like a student residence, and in Marsden, West Yorkshire, Malcolm and Muriel need to modernise their house to give them a good chance of securing a sale.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Amit Kleinberger, the CEO and co-owner of frozen yoghurt chain Menchie's, poses as a participant in a reality TV contest to find out whether consistency is being maintained in his stores. The company has experienced rapid growth and Amit tries to establish what changes must be made to become a billion-dollar business.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wirth - the CEO of a California ski resort - goes undercover to learn more about his company's working practices as he prepares to merge an existing operation with a new acquisition.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Luke Doonan and Jasmine Harman help a couple who have lived in the same home for 40 years decide between new properties either side of the Channel. Sheila is drawn to Bodmin, Cornwall, where she spent her childhood holidays, while Fred is keen to up sticks to Limousin in France.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Things do not run smoothly for three Bournemouth couples, as one pair are late with their cooking, talk of butchering causes upset and a pescatarian is accidentally served meat.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Hampshire compete, beginning with an evening of Eastern European cuisine with Stevan and Clare, followed by Josh and Bettie, and James and Victoria.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to La Grange, a suburb of Chicago, to help the owners of Cafe 36, an upmarket bistro threatening to destroy the marriage of its owners due to the scale of their financial losses. The head chef's attitude to quality control is driving customers away, and it is up to Gordon Ramsay to turn the business around.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to reverse the fortunes of a diner in Bellmore, New York, where a talented cook's work is being undone by the manager's marketing plans - putting the finances in dire straits.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two couples previously searching for their first homes together in London. Sarah and Ian wanted a house in their beloved Balham in the south-west of the city, while Louise and Matt had second thoughts about settling in the north-east, but both pairs were forced to alter their expectations and compromise on location.(n)

programme.title: The Knowledge: The World's Toughest Taxi Test
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the test that all black cab drivers working in the city of London must take, one of the world's toughest exams - The Knowledge of London. Each candidate must memorise the capital's 25,000 streets, traffic restrictions and ever-changing points of interest, which takes an average of four years of determination to successfully pass.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: It took 30-year-old Louise and her husband Andy six years to conceive. Now they're looking forward to meeting their baby and showing it off to their worried family and health care assistant Olwen. Cameras also follow Sammy, 23, who is about to have her third child. An undiagnosed condition drove a wedge between Sammy and her mum, when her bad behaviour was put down to teenage hormones, until a long-awaited diagnosis of endometriosis when she was 19 enabled them to build bridges.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Something unprecedented happens in the First Dates restaurant tonight. When stunning 25-year-old Sasha is stood up, an unexpected knight in shining armour is waiting in the wings - waiter Sam. Meanwhile, 38-year-old sales manager Scott, who is looking for someone to mend his broken heart after the failure of an eight-year relationship, meets 28-year-old PA Victoria, and 55-year-old receptionist Debbie has her first date with a woman, in the shape of 59-year-old divorced security guard Ann.(n)

programme.title: Katie Piper's Face To Face
programme.desc: Katie Piper invites women with facial conditions to Central London's Harvey Nichols store for a special makeover. But what they don't know is that the glamorous person helping them shares the same facial condition - will they be able to tell?.(n)

programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: People struggling to live on the dole while also caring for their furry friends, including 33-year-old Sheffield woman Billie, who claims more than £5,000 a year and shares her one-bedroom council home with an astonishing 32 pets. Rugby husband and wife Kim and Gary claim £900 credit per month, but with debts of at least £2,000, they face the heart-breaking choice of losing either their home or some of their five pets. And depression-sufferer Paul prefers animals to people, finding comfort in caring for his 24 pets. He receive disability and employment support, but has been battling for some time to prove he is entitled to his benefits.(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: A well-regarded spec script by A-list screenwriter David Koepp became this stylish thriller from director David Fincher. Jodie Foster stars as Meg Altman, a single mother of an diabetic preteen daughter, Sarah (Kristen Stewart). Meg's going through an unhappy divorce that forces her and Sarah to move into a new home. They choose a deluxe New York brownstone that coincidentally boasts an unusual feature: a "panic room," a vault-like hidden space capable of literally sealing itself off from the rest of the building. With its thick steel door on springs, separate ventilation and communications systems, and video monitors linked to cameras mounted throughout the home, the room is an impregnable fortress. It quickly comes in handy when the Altmans' new residence is invaded by a trio of thieves: Junior (Jared Leto), Burnham (Forest Whitaker), and Raoul (Dwight Yoakam). Meg and Sarah are able to secure themselves in the panic room before the robbers can get to them, but it turns out that Sarah's medication is still on the outside, the phone's not yet connected, and the loot the gang's seeking is inside the panic room with them. A cat-and-mouse battle of wits ensues, with Meg trying to outwit their captors over the course of one very long night, as her daughter's health dissipates. Panic Room (2002) co-stars Ann Magnuson, Patrick Bauchau, and Koepp's fellow screenwriter, Andrew Kevin Walker, in a cameo role(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: A man and two of his friends turn his place, which is near a college campus, into a mad party house. This irks the college dean(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: The Office star Rainn Wilson portrays a drummer named "Fish," who gets a second shot at fame 20 years after getting kicked out of his band on the very night they signed the record contract that made them stars. Fish has spent the past two decades languishing at soul-crushing day jobs while his old bandmates became legends, continuing to grace magazine covers and dominate the radio. He might just get another chance at musical success, however, when his teenage cousin invites him to drum for his high school garage band, and they end up catching the ear of record executives. Now, Fish is determined to live the hedonistic rock & roll lifestyle he missed out on 20 years ago, but his new bandmates don't appreciate his hard partying -- and neither do his middle-aged knees. This Fox Atomic comedy co-stars Christina Applegate. Shawn Levy (Night at the Museum) and Tom McNulty co-produced the feature, which was penned by Wallace Wolodarsky and Maya Forbes, and directed by Peter Cattaneo (Opal Dream)(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Well-developed characters and rousing battle scenes buoy this epic high-seas adventure set at the height of the Napoleonic Wars. An English captain leads his warship, the HMS Surprise, in battle against a formidable French vessel(n)

programme.title: San Andreas
programme.desc: In this high-octane thrill ride, a helicopter pilot races to rescue his daughter and estranged wife as a series of massive earthquakes devastate California. Meanwhile, a Cal Tech professor attempts to warn other citizens(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: A young stud who is going nowhere fast in small-town Texas heads for New York in this classic downbeat drama which won an Oscar for best picture. On the sleazy streets of the Big Apple, Joe Buck's dreams of finding glamour and adventure are shattered by a succession of unsavoury incidents, but he finds a friend in the unlikely shape of Ratso Rizzo, a street hustler with a wasting lung disease(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Kevin Costner gives a sensitive performance in this intriguing thriller about a doctor who tries to communicate with his dead spouse. After his wife dies while on a Red Cross mission, a man (Costner) is plagued by what he believes are messages from her, and tries to decipher what they mean. Kathy Bates, Joe Morton, Ron Rifkin, Linda Hunt, Susanna Thompson, Jacob Vargas(n)

programme.title: A Beautiful Mind
programme.desc: Four Oscars, including Best Picture and Best Director, went to Ron Howard's engrossing drama about John Nash, the volatile Nobel Prize-winning mathematician(n)

programme.title: The Birdcage
programme.desc: Flamboyant Hollywood remake of the 1979 French farce La Cage Aux Folles. When his son's conservative future in-laws come to town, gay club owner Armand and his cross-dressing partner Albert are forced to play husband and wife(n)

programme.title: Sweet November
programme.desc: Touching, tragic romantic drama with Keanu Reeves and Charlize Theron who fall in love with only a short amount of time to spend together(n)

programme.title: Reindeer Games
programme.desc: Upon release from jail, a con adopts his dead ex-cellmate's identity just to meet the man's girlfriend - but the girl's brother had plans to use the dead con's expert knowledge in a casino robbery, and the imposter is forced to take part. Also known as Reindeer Games(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: In this stylish and suspenseful tale, Charlize Theron plays a woman who suspects something isn't quite right with her astronaut husband (Johnny Depp) after he returns to Earth following a mission. Joe Morton, Nick Cassavetes, Samantha Eggar(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: A woman on the lam with her young daughter takes drastic steps when her abusive husband tracks them down(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: Philip Seymour Hoffman won a much-deserved Best Actor Oscar for his uncannily astounding performance as "In Cold Blood" author Truman Capote. The exceptional biopic spans the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece. Catherine Keener received a Best Supporting Oscar nod as Capote's friend and researcher Harper Lee, who a few years later would publish "To Kill a Mockingbird." Dan Futterman's script was also Oscar-nominated. Clifton Collins Jr., Chris Cooper, Bob Balaban, Amy Ryan(n)

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Love, treachery, and broken furniture are the hallmarks of this rollicking action drama. Dalton (Patrick Swayze) has a Ph.D., but rather than make a living teaching Socrates at some university, he's opted to become a top-drawer "cooler" -- an expert barroom bouncer who can break up fights without getting himself killed in the process. Dalton is hired to keep the peace at the Double Duce, a rough-and-tumble honky tonk in Jasper, Missouri, where beer-soaked free-for-alls are a nightly event. Dalton is hurt on his first night on the job, and he is patched up by "Doc" Clay (Kelly Lynch), a beautiful woman working as the town's physician. Dalton and Doc immediately hit it off, but Dalton learns that another man, Brad Wesley (Ben Gazzara), already has his eye on her. Wesley is a man used to getting his way; he's an extortionist and crime boss who has nearly everyone in Jasper under his thumb, and he sets out to teach Dalton a lesson, while Dalton is determined to clean up the town like he breaks up brawls at the Double Duce. Sam Elliott plays Dalton's mentor Wade, and Red West, a one-time member of Elvis Presley's "Memphis Mafia," appears as Webster; Canadian blues-rock guitarist Jeff Healey leads the Double Duce house band(n)

programme.title: K-PAX
programme.desc: A man found wandering at New York Central Station is taken into psychiatric care because he claims to be Prot from the planet K-PAX, "1,000 of your light years away". Psychiatrist Dr. Mark Powell doesn't believe him and tries to unlock the trauma, but as Prot reveals knowledge that only a handful of astronomers could know and shows an uncanny knack for helping his fellow patients heal, even Powell begins to wonder. Then clues that Prot lets slip under hypnosis lead Powell to a more earthly explanation, or so he thinks, in Iain Softley's assured, gripping sci-fi fantasy(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A man gets a last-chance job coaching a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team and faces the dual challenge of bringing this underdog team to the 1951 state championship and redeeming himself from a mysterious past(n)

programme.title: Quick Change
programme.desc: Crime comedy about a man whose ingenious plans go awry after he robs a New York bank disguised as a clown. As the police gather outside, he and his accomplices realise they had not taken into account the horrors of getting around the Big Apple when they planned the getaway. Bill Murray's directorial debut(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Kate Hudson and Anne Hathaway are a scream as two lifelong best friends who schedule their dream weddings for the same date, at the same place (New York City's Plaza Hotel) and at the same time and neither is willing to budge(n)

programme.title: Entourage

programme.title: Suicide Kings
programme.desc: In this hip crime drama, a spoiled rich teen's (Henry Thomas) sister is abducted, and he and his punk friends decide to kidnap an ex-mob boss (Christopher Walken) as a negotiating tool. But the wily mobster turns the tables on his bungling captors. Denis Leary, Sean Patrick Flanery, Jay Mohr, Jeremy Sisto, Laura San Giacomo(n)

programme.title: Wall Street

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: Picked to lead the first US troops into Vietnam, Lt Col Hal Moore drills his boys in preparation for battle. But Moore isn't just a soldier: he is a son, a husband and a father(n)

programme.desc: A legal expert whose days of trying cases are long behind him, Harvard Law School professor Paul Armstrong is moved by a plea he receives from a Florida death row inmate, Bobby Earl. It seems that the educated, upstanding Earl has been railroaded by an overeager sheriff zealously trying to solve the kidnapping and murder of a little girl(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part two of three. A witness reveals that personal trainer Newman flew to Los Angeles on the night of the murder, leading the officers to believe they have the wrong man. When blood matching the dead film studio executive's is found in their new suspect's car, they soon arrest him but their case may not be clear-cut enough to warrant a conviction. Sam Waterston stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Conclusion of a three-part story. The investigation into a movie studio boss's murder becomes further complicated when fresh evidence points to yet another suspect. Meanwhile, the ex-husband of the deceased goes to trial to face accusations of having a hand in the crime - is an innocent man about to be convicted? Sam Waterston stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Stella fears she may have been infected with HIV-positive blood while conducting inquiries at a murder scene, and Danny investigates the case of a woman whose body has been found in a bath filled with water and rose petals, but has trouble establishing the cause of death. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Muslim US Marine is found seemingly shot dead near a mosque that has been linked to an al-Qaeda recruiter. Ducky refuses to perform an autopsy out of respect for the man's religion, but Abby runs tests that reveal his demise was actually due to poisoning from a rare octopus venom. Meanwhile, McGee goes into the mosque intending to plant a concealed microphone - but discovers someone has had the same idea.(n)

programme.desc: McCoy tries to prosecute a pilot accused of murdering her married lover for trying to end their relationship, but finds himself battling the Navy and the office of the Judge Advocate General, who seem intent on obstructing his efforts. Acclaimed American detective drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate a seemingly random drive-by shooting, but soon suspect the victim's husband may know more than he is letting on. To make matters worse, the hospital in which the victim was pronounced dead appears to have contributed to her demise - putting a highly respected surgeon's reputation on the line. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami

Further investigation leads the officers to an offshore operation producing high-quality counterfeit banjoes. The forensic spin-off show's 100th episode, starring David Caruso and Emily Procter.(n)

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Vance sticks rigidly to the rules as he investigates the death of a fellow agent, but Gibbs and Franks take matters into their own hands to catch the killers. The case also leads to major changes for the agency. Drama, starring Rocky Carroll, Mark Harmon and Muse Watson.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Reese and Finch find themselves trapped in a hospital during an outbreak of a lethal flu virus, and Shaw executes her escape plan, only to find herself in prison in Johannesburg.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman is subjected to an attempted rape that bears the telltale signs of a sexual predator - but he was put behind bars in 2004. When the case is reopened, Benson is accused of depriving an innocent man of his liberty, so she works on the theory a copycat is on the loose. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Boyd Hartwell, a hedge fund manager away in Hong Kong on business, is forced to watch helplessly as a video call home is interrupted by an intruder, who proceeds to rape and kidnap his wife. A ransom is issued, demaning that Boyd offer up 250,000 dollars for the safe return of his spouse, but when the person collecting the money turns out to be the missing wife herself, Benson and the team realise there might be more to this case than they initially suspected. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.desc: A woman is killed shortly after participating in a charity event, and it emerges that she had tried to reveal the involvement of its hosts with terrorists. Crime drama, starring David Caruso and Emily Procter.(n)

programme.desc: The Real Paul Anka. In Philadelphia for daughter April's math contest, Luke (Scott Patterson) visits Jess (Milo Ventimiglia) at the latter's new bookstore. Rory (Alexis Bledel) also shows up at Jess' establishment after a fight with Logan (Matt Czuchry), whereupon she and Luke exchange a few pointed words. Meanwhile, Lorelai (Lauren Graham) shudders at the thought of her parents (Edward Herrmann, Kelly Bishop) moving to Stars Hollow. The episode's title refers to the fact that Lorelai has named her pet dog Paul Anka -- which of course necessitates a cameo appearance by the "real" Paul Anka in a dream sequence(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.sub-title: I Get a Sidekick Out of You
programme.desc: I Get a Sidekick Out of You. When the bachelor and bachelorette parties for Zach (Todd Lowe) and Lane (Keiko Agena) respectively fall through, the couple is forced to improvise. Informed by Lane's tradition-bound mother that she will have to have an escort at the wedding, and with Luke out of town, Lorelai (Lauren Graham) attends the ceremony with Christopher (David Sutcliffe). The religious beliefs of the couple's parents require that two entirely different wedding services be held, making Lorelai all the more depressed -- here are Zach and Lane getting married twice in the same day, and she hasn't been to the altar even once -- not even with the father of her child!(n)

programme.title: Bring It On Again
programme.desc: Whittier (Anne Judson-Yager) arrives at the fictional California State College hoping to join the national champion varsity cheerleading team. She meets up with her friend from cheerleading camp, Monica (Faune Chambers), and they're both impressive at the tryouts. Head cheerleader Tina (Bree Turner) is ready to ask them to join the team, but Dean Sebastian (Kevin Cooney) goes a step further, telling Tina that Whittier will be the next head cheerleader. This angers Tina's pal Marni (Joie Lenz), who had the position staked out, but Tina goes along with the plan, taking Whittier under her wing. Whittier meets Derek (Richard Lee Jackson), a campus deejay who immediately takes a shine to her. But Tina is very demanding and controlling. She warns Whittier that Derek is not the type of boy she should be dating. Monica is bothered by Tina's meddling, but Whittier momentarily lets her cheerleading ambition get the better of her, and breaks it off with Derek. Then Tina, upset with Monica's sassy attitude, forces Whittier to choose between her friendship and the squad. Whittier and Monica get fed up and quit the team, but Whittier's school spirit cannot be suppressed. With Monica's help, she gathers up the outcasts from the drama club, the dance club, and other groups that have lost their funding and forms a ragtag squad of her own, determined to battle the varsity squad for a spot at the national championship. Directed by Damon Santostefano (Three to Tango), Bring It On Again was released straight-to-video; aside from its subject matter, it has no direct connection to the original Bring It On(n)

programme.desc: Super Cool Party People. When Logan (Matt Czuchry) is seriously injured in a stunt for "The Life and Death Brigade," Rory (Alexis Bledel) is unable to get any information on his condition, forcing her to swallow her pride and contact Logan's father Mitchum (Gregg Henry). programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Driving Miss Gilmore. Health issues dominate this episode, as Lorelai (Lauren Graham) becomes Emily's (Kelly Bishop) chauffeur after the latter's eye surgery, and Rory (Alexis Bledel) tends to Logan's every need upon his return from the hospital. Though physically on the mend, Logan (Matt Czuchry) suffers emotionally when he reads a scathing newspaper interview granted by his father Mitchum. Elsewhere, Luke (Scott Patterson) finds out that his sister Liz (Kathleen Wilhoite) is pregnant; Jackson (Jackson Douglas) and Sookie (Melissa McCarthy) must quickly dispose of a marijuana crop left behind by his former employees; and a surprise gift from her parents knocks Lorelai for a loop(n)

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Brideless Groom. Shemp Howard plays a vocal coach in this Three Stooges short. His most adoring student is a homely young miss who cheerfully mangles "The Voice of Spring." As soon as her lesson is over, Moe and Larry show up and inform him that his Uncle Caleb has left him a half a million dollars -- provided that he is married by six o'clock that evening. Shemp needs a bride in a hurry, so he heads to a phone booth with his little black book and a handful of nickels, but he only manages to get tangled up with Moe. Then he sees a pretty girl (Christine McIntyre), who's a new resident in the building, but she turns out to be a violent psychopath. Shemp has no choice but to take his awful voice student to the altar, but as the justice of the peace (Emil Sitka) is preparing to wed them, an angry group of Shemp's former girlfriends show up -- Moe ran a notice in the paper announcing his dilemma. The women battle furiously to become Shemp's bride, and the Stooges are all the worse for wear. The semi-conscious Shemp manages to say "I do" to the singing student, and when he comes to and realizes what he's done, his response is to scream, "Help!" If this short bears a few similarities to the Buster Keaton silent Seven Chances, it could be because writer Clyde Bruckman worked on both films. Emil Sitka's line, "Hold hands, you lovebirds," was immortalized in Pulp Fiction -- it can be heard while John Travolta is pumping a hypodermic full of adrenaline into the overdosed Uma Thurman(n)

programme.desc: Mummy's Dummies. This time we're in ancient Egypt, where the Three Stooges own a used-chariot dealership ("I'm Honest Moe, he's Honest Shemp, and that's...that's Larry"). When they bamboozle the Captain of the Royal Guard (Ralph Dunn) out of 400 shekels for a defective chariot, the Stooges are arrested and brought before the mighty King Rootentooten (Vernon Dent). Sentenced to be thrown to the crocodiles, the boys save themselves by curing the King's toothache, whereupon they are appointed Royal Chamberlains--and in this capacity, our heroes expose a crooked tax collector (Philip Van Zandt). They meet when Charlton visits Dundee's homeland - the Australian outback - to interview him and find out about his brushes with death at the hands of a vicious crocodile. Intrigued by the man, Charlton invites him to visit her in New York to return his hospitality and, taking up her offer, Dundee is transported to the Big Apple and is amazed at what he finds. programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy (David Mazouz) stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force. This tale of terror was directed by Wolf Creek's Greg McLean. Kevin Bacon, Radha Mitchell, and Lucy Fry star in a Blumhouse Productions film(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: In this supernatural thriller, Tom Witzky (Kevin Bacon) is a fairly typical working-class guy living in Chicago with his wife Maggie (Kathryn Erbe) and his son Jake (Zachary David Cope). One night at a party, Tom gets into a lively discussion with his sister-in-law, Lisa (Illeana Douglas), who believes in psychic communication and the power of hypnosis. He challenges Lisa to hypnotize him, and she plants in him a post-hypnotic suggestion to be more open-minded. But the results aren't quite what Lisa or Tom expected; Tom now senses an air of terrible dread throughout his house and is convinced that evil lurks just around the corner. He also sees the spirit of a girl from the neighborhood who disappeared months ago -- and Jake sees the spirit as well. Stir of Echoes was based on a novel by Richard Matheson, whose work inspired such disparate films as Somewhere in Time and The Incredible Shrinking Man; it was written and directed by David Koepp, who wrote the screenplays for Jurassic Park and Mission: Impossible(n)

programme.title: Frank Miller's Sin City
programme.desc: (2005) Adaptation of Frank Miller's graphic novel. A collection of interweaving stories all based in the corrupt, crime infested hell-hole that is Basin City. Heavily influenced by film-noir, the main storylines concern a hulking brute called Marv, who is seeking the murderer of a beautiful woman who was killed while asleep in bed with him, a photographer called Dwight who is callously used and seeks revenge, and a soon-to-be-retiring policeman called Hartigan.Dir: Frank Miller, Robert Rodriguez, Quentin Tarantino(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate

The dealer is hired by a wealthy bibliophile to locate the two remaining copies of a 17th-century book entitled The Nine Gates to the Kingdom of Shadows. As he travels from New York to Madrid and Paris, he learns that the book is rumoured to have been written by the Devil - and to contain the key to conjuring him up(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming

Upon returning home from the line of duty, National Guard Captain Ted Cogan thought his life would go back to normal, until he started seeing visions of a group of innocent bystanders he inadvertently killed in Iraq. With his family on the brink of destruction, Ted turns to a psychic that aids him in understanding what needs to be done to put these restless souls at peace - even if it means giving up his own life(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: France Falls (May - June 1940). Spring 1940: France falls under German attack. On film: the Maginot line, where the French wait while German Panzer divisions advance through the unprotected Ardennes forest. Parachutists invade neutral Holland, Rommel defeats the French at Sedan and the German war machine moves on to Paris. At Dunkirk, Allied troops are evacuated. Belgium capitulates. The Franco-German Armistice is signed at Compiegne. Laurence Olivier is the host(n)

programme.title: The World at War

Originally appearing on television in 1974, the popular show was hosted by Laurence Olivier. In this first episode, the producers show the terrible cost of the war -- worldwide devastation and the deaths of 55 million people. The program examines the politics and economy of Germany that brought forth the Nazi Party and the leadership of Adolf Hitler(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Distant War (September 1939 - May 1940). Chronicling the events that followed Britain's declaration of war against Germany. programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers are locked in a battle of wills with a Canadian timber wolf, who keeps trying to escape his enclosure, and special cameras are set up to watch the lions after dark.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore a bungalow in Radcliffe-on-Trent, Nottinghamshire, a former community centre in the New Forest in Hampshire and a lower ground-floor flat in Margate, Kent. After the presenters have given their thoughts on the properties, they meet the people who have bought them at auction to find out what renovations they have planned.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The agents will not take no for an answer at a hotel with a debt to pay, and Lawrence and Ken visit a garage after a customer discovered the car he bought had been in a crash.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates fake Frozen merchandise that left a girl scarred for life, looks at the fake hi-tech coats that could have terrible consequences, and reports on fraudsters trying to steal millions from companies, councils and charities across the UK.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: At Wetherby racecourse, West Yorkshire, antiques experts Charles Hanson and Kate Bliss help two teams find items likely to make the highest profit at auction. Presenter Anita Manning observes their progress and also pays a visit to the place where the modern railway began.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.sub-title: I Don't Do Animals - Part One.
programme.desc: Zara and Emma's trip to the conference does not go according to plan, while Al is exasperated by the man who is running their team-building course.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts as colleagues Julie and Michael from Teesside work together and answers questions to crack the three-digit code that will open a safe full of money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple searching for a home in the North Cornwall countryside with a budget of £525,000, and also visits the annual Royal Cornwall Show.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a recycling centre in Walsall, West Midlands, featuring a pair of chairs, a plant stand and printed bean sacks.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from the RAF Museum at Hendon in London, where items up for auction include a nautilus shells and some Superman film memorabilia. With antiques experts Michael Baggott and Mark Stacet.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Liberal Democrats.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker hosts the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Eight more hopefuls enter the MasterChef kitchen, challenged to create a dish using ingredients taken from the MasterChef Market, including chicken legs, quail, salmon and lamb rump. The cooks have an hour and 20 minutes to come up a dish to impress the judges, before three of the contestants are sent home. For the second challenge, the remaining five competitors are asked to create an exciting two-course menu, with previous MasterChef winners and finalists joining John and Gregg as they decide who will make it to the following stage of the competition.(n)

programme.title: Reported Missing
programme.desc: New series. Multiple cameras follow the hunt for missing people across Britain, from the police tasked with finding them, to the family members and loved ones left at home. In this episode, a 12-year-old boy in Darlington goes missing after storming out of a row with his mother, and police search for a missing 13-year-old girl in a rural town in County Durham, who left behind a worrying suicide note.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: After moving in with her sister, Kayleigh is now travelling to work on her own, but will she manage to resist temptation or call her old car share friend, John? Return of the sitcom about two supermarket employees, starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Sue Barker asks the questions in the light-hearted quiz, with swimmer Fran Halsall, St Helens star Jon Wilkin, Olympic bronze medal-winning boxer Joshua Buatsi and Scottish footballer Kim Little joining team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell in a test of their sporting knowledge.(n)

programme.title: Child of Our Time
programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary charting the development of 25 children born at the start of the millennium returns to follow the participants as they turn 16. Robert Winston and Tanya Byron discover how the teenagers' changing brains means that what they choose to do at this age can shape their lives forever, and explore research in human biology and neuroscience that reveals how the most baffling aspects of this stage of life can be explained and illuminated by the latest understanding of the changing teenage brain.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle discover the lengths the keepers will go for the animal orphans, and the stakes are high as vital testing for a killer disease continues.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin explore properties about to be sold in Brompton in Kent, Wolverhampton and Newcastle-under-Lyme.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence and Kev seize equipment from a sports car specialist on behalf of a customer whose car was left dripping oil after a botched repair.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: People posing as bailiffs to threaten small businesses and conning home-owners with forged trade association logos. Plus, fake breathalysers that could cost drivers their licence.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams compete at Newark Antiques and Collectors Fair, Nottinghamshire. Ben Cooper and Natasha Raskin are the experts in residence helping the sides in their pursuit for profits, as they go on to sell their items at Charles Hanson's saleroom in Derby. Plus, presenter Paul Laidlaw recounts a tale illustrating how good luck proved as effective as good judgement with the acquisition of a pair of 400-year-old powder flasks.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.sub-title: I Don't Do Animals - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The sweat lodge experience has an unexpected effect on Al, while Emma and Zara go out of their way to avoid attending the conference. Ian Midlane stars.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Long-time friends Jonathan, Ben and Ricky return to try to work out the three-digit code to crack open a safe full of money. Matt Allwright asks the questions in the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple who want to relocate to Cornwall and have a budget of £460,000, and gets a birds-eye view of Britain's largest rainforest at the Eden Project.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is joined by Norman Wilkinson and Daniel Heath, who between them revamp a guest bed, a tired armchair and an artist's easel - turning the latter into a vanity unit.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antiques experts Will Axon and Mark Stacey visit the Oxford Union to admire another selection of the public's personal treasures, including a First World War bayonet. Plus, presenter Paul Martin charts the birth of rock 'n' roll through the work of music photographer Harry Hammond.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the UK Independence Party.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Angela Scanlon present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle apologises to Sharon for her behaviour and reaches out to Martin, hoping that the anniversary of Mark's death will help bring them back together again. Bex is taken back when Madison says sorry for everything, and Kim and Vincent invite Kush and Denise round for dinner. Ian is put out when the Vic holds a `fish and chips' evening - so Steven comes up with a plan to fight back.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The third week of heats continue with the amateurs given just 80 minutes to devise one dish using ingredients from the MasterChef market. On offer are chicken wings, quail, pancetta, brown shrimp, salmon and haddock. After three are sent home, the others cook two courses to impress not just John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also the 2013 finalists - Saira Hamilton, Larkin Cen and champion Natalie Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin and the team journey south to the oldest islands in the Galapagos to see the impact humans have had on this pristine wilderness. Moving on to the island of Isabela, Liz descends into a vertical lava cave, then makes her final land-based stop on Santa Cruz, where she meets a man on a mission to protect the giant tortoise population. Finally, she dives into the deep blue waters to witness the birth of a new island. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bronx to Bradford: Friars on a Mission
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of five brothers from a Bradford friary. The Community of the Franciscan Friars of the Renewal originated in the Bronx in New York. In Bradford, they run regular soup kitchens for the poor and the homeless, and are also hoping to restore an old run-down church to attract new followers. All this while devoting time to prayer and worship. How challenging is it for them to help those in need while they themselves must lead such a humble life?.(n)

programme.title: Child of Our Time
programme.desc: Part two of two. Professors Robert Winston and Tanya Byron follow the youngsters through their GCSE year to discover how the teenagers are being shaped by these unique times. In Scotland, Nathan shares how it feels growing up in an unconventional family - attitudes to his father's homosexuality have transformed in his lifetime. And in Essex, Taliesin reveals what impact his online gaming habit is having on friendships and his sleep.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The team examines the impact of associations with famous people on the value of antiques and collectibles, with presenter Paul Martin discovering just how much the signatures of the Beatles are worth.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence makes a suspicious discovery during the eviction of a group of squatters, while Tommy and Craig go looking for a steel company boss who owes money.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: A pair of yellow deck chair frames, a wooden vice and a sideboard are the items rescued in Surrey and transformed by Sarah Moore and her team.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: The food writer and former Great British Bake Off judge continues to celebrate the everyday food and ingredients she has always loved, from hearty and wholesome ideas to easy-to-make crowd-pleasers and family classics. In this edition, Mary focuses on food that exemplifies indulgence, demonstrating mouth-watering dishes that give the mundane a lift with lashings of naughtiness. Treats are in store as she investigates the history of the British pie and reveals the secrets to making an easy sticky toffee pudding.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.sub-title: From Berneray to Pabbay: The Riddle of the Sands.
programme.desc: Paul Murton returns to explore more of the remote and fascinating places that lie off the mainland, beginning with a cluster of islands in the Outer Hebrides. He starts his journey just off the coast of North Uist at Berneray, then heads south to Grimsay and Kirkibost, before ending on the deserted whisky island of Pabbay.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.sub-title: Track Cycling World Championships: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces action from the opening day at the Hong Kong Velodrome, featuring the finals of the men's and women's team sprints, and the women's scratch race.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Inspector George Gently and The Professionals star Martin Shaw is the latest celebrity to go in search of his roots, and he's particularly interested in finding out more about his paternal grandfather Edwin, who was rarely spoken about by his family. The actor has only one photo of his ancestor, which shows him aged roughly 17 and wearing a military uniform. By zooming in on the picture, Martin's brother was able to identify their grandfather's badge, which suggests he was in the Royal Marines. Now, by meeting with a military historian, Martin tries to fill in the rest of the story, and in the process learns more about Edwin's role in defending Birmingham against German air assaults during the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Leonora is a 16-year-old orangutan who has been living in a commune on a protected island run by the Borneo Orangutan Survival Foundation. This documentary follows Leonora and her three-year-old infant Lemar as they undertake an epic and life-changing journey by boat, road and finally helicopter, before being released into the rainforest.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough: 60 Years in the Wild
programme.desc: David Attenborough reflects on scientific discoveries in his lifetime that have transformed the way the natural world is viewed - including evidence of how and where life began, the ways in which continents move, and research into animal communication and behaviour. He also recalls some of his more hair-raising attempts to bring new science to a television audience, and clips show him standing in the shadow of an erupting volcano and being charged at by a group of armed New Guinea tribesmen.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Wonnacott oversees proceedings as experts Kate Bliss and David Harper assist two teams when the antiques challenge heads to the Lincoln Showground.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore an Cornish museum sign, an old banger boat, and Julie and Amanda repair a special teddy bear who has lost one of his eyes.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Minneapolis and St Paul, where he learns how the power of the Mississippi helped Minneapolis become a great industrial centre. Later in St Paul, he explores the birthplace of F Scott Fitzgerald, and meets with a Native American expert to discover more about a dark chapter in American history.(n)

programme.title: Me and My Dog: The Ultimate Contest
programme.desc: Chris Packham hosts the show where dog owners and their pets compete in a series of unique challenges to test the levels of trust between man and dog. This time, the Red team have the first chance to score points in a paddle-boarding challenge in Lake Windermere, while the Yellow team take on a series of canine woodland obstacle courses. Finally, the teams take part in a challenging cross-country race, where the owners and their pets are tethered together, hoping to triumph in the second stage of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Second Chance Summer: Tuscany
programme.desc: The group begin to settle into rural living after their first week living in Tuscany, but a storm forces them to race against time to complete the ambitious Sangiovese grape harvest, and rescue the farm's biggest income. Meanwhile, the group members look to expand the farm's potential with a new Bed and Breakfast venture, and begin to renovate an empty out-building. However, as the first guests start to arrive, all does not go according to plan, and temperamental Tuscan plumbing puts a spanner in the works for their grand ambitions.(n)

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: New series. The presenter takes to the streets of Cwmbran to learn the business of selling houses. Gavin, Rhod's mentor, believes happy people sell, placing extra pressure on the grumpy comedian. Can Rhod's unique approach cope with the high-octane sales environment and make him employee of the month, or will he have the home buyers running scared?.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Obesity: How Prejudiced Is the NHS
programme.desc: Professor Rachel Batterham, head of the obesity services at University College Hospital, examines the medical cost of obesity that is threatening to bankrupt the NHS. She explores whether there is 'fat prejudice' against obese patients within parts of the service that is stopping them accessing a potentially cost effective surgery, even when recent scientific research supports it.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: While Louis proposes an audacious alliance with England, along with an unexpected envoy to negotiate it, the normally brazen Beatrice fears her secrets being revealed. The period drama depicting the decadent and turbulent early reign of King Louis XIV continues. Supported by Inside Versailles documentary shorts. Starring George Blagden, Alexander Vlahos, Tygh Runyan, Stuart Bowman, Amira Casar and Evan Williams.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Another eight hopefuls are given just 80 minutes to invent and cook one dish from the ingredients available in the MasterChef market. On offer today are poussin, lamb rack and duck breast as well as mussels, prawns and crab. The stakes are high in this opening round as three of the cooks will be sent home, while the remaining five have one more challenge standing between them and a quarter-final place. They have to cook a menu that will impress not just John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also the 2015 finalists - Emma Spitzer, Tony Rodd and champion Simon Wood.(n)

programme.title: The Best of British Takeaways
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge celebrates the UK's favourite takeaways, beginning with a look at what makes the best fish and chips and the trade secrets behind them. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey discovers that the origins of our national dish aren't actually British at all.(n)

programme.title: Down the Mighty River with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist travels down the Baliem River in New Guinea from its source to the sea, hoping to encounter the ancient tribes and dangerous wildlife that live long its banks and in the surrounding jungle. He begins his journey inland at Lake Habbema, and braves some of the world's fiercest white water rapids. Along the way, he stays in a village belonging to the Dani tribe and ventures into some previously unexplored caves.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The team offers advice on making money from 20th-century collectibles, with presenter Paul Martin visiting London's Design Museum and expert Anita Manning exploring the legacy of Glaswegian designer, architect and artist Charles Rennie Mackintosh.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The agents will not take no for an answer at a hotel with a debt to pay, and Lawrence and Ken visit a garage after a customer discovered the car he bought had been in a crash.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a recycling centre in Walsall, West Midlands, featuring a pair of chairs, a plant stand and printed bean sacks.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don begins a brand new project when he starts a new soft fruit garden, and also plants new potatoes and divides herbaceous plants in the jewel garden. Frances Tophill visits an extraordinary tropical garden in Barbados developed from a collapsed cave, while the programme also catches up with exponent of gardening for wildlife Chris Baines, in his own small town garden. Plus, as part of the series' 50th anniversary, Mark Lane nominates the plant he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half century. Including weather.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland: Ballina to Westport.
programme.desc: On the last leg of Michael Portillo's long journey from Wexford to Westport, a fashionable Victorian seaweed bath is followed by a steamy scene in Ballina. On tenterhooks in Foxford, Michael discovers the visionary charity of an entrepreneurial nun, learns of a double tragedy at Clew Bay and begins a pilgrimage to the summit of Croagh Patrick, Ireland's holy mountain. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.sub-title: Track Cycling World Championships: 2017 Day Two.
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces action from the second day at the Hong Kong Velodrome, featuring the finals of the men's and women's team pursuits, and the men's scratch race and keirin.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Presenter Chris Hollins reminisces about a 1988 holiday in Oxford he took as part of a cricket tour, being driven back to the location in a classic Mini by the Strictly Come Dancing judge. He is taken to the university halls he stayed in as a 17-year-old, and Len invites some of Chris's friends from the 1980s holiday to take part in a game from back in the day called Spoof.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: DJ, actor and presenter Reggie Yates sets out to trace his ancestry. His mother and father were both born in Ghana, but he never knew his grandparents, and he is keen to know where his surname comes from, believing it might be Dutch. However, as he looks further back, his family tree springs some unexpected surprises.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough: 60 Years in the Wild
programme.desc: David Attenborough reflects on environmental changes during his film-making career, the pioneering conservationists whose footsteps he followed and the revolution in attitudes toward nature. On a tropical beach in Malaysia, David recalls how in the 1950s he dug up turtle eggs to eat and releases newly hatched turtles into the wild. Finally he asks whether changing attitudes and greater knowledge of the world will be enough to save it for future generations. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Chris Gower and David Harper head to Anglesey to help two teams pick up deals at a fair before selling them at auction. Plus, Tim Wonnacott explores Waddesdon Manor in Buckinghamshire.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A barometer, rowing oars that could have a hidden past and a pinball machine that has spent the last few years being used as a kitchen worktop are restored.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry's Easter Feast
programme.desc: Mary explores the roots of her faith through the medium of food, asking how Britain eats its way through Easter, and sharing her own favourite Easter recipes, including hot cross buns, Simnel cake and roast lamb. In this first episode, she discovers the traditions followed by diverse British families and communities during Lent and Good Friday, and the food that brings them together as each prepare for their Easter celebrations.(n)

programme.title: The World According to Kids
programme.desc: New series. Children aged between six and 11 from across the UK are equipped with cameras to reveal what they really think of the world, while a number of challenges offer an intimate insight into how they think. In the opening show, children from a debating club in Bradford, a pony club in Berkshire and a drama class in Gloucester explore their feelings of love and hate. Eight-year-old Abigail discusses her parents' impending wedding, Daniel is looking forward to seeing his father - who has been posted overseas with the Army - and Edmund just loves to hate his little sister.(n)

programme.title: The Last Kingdom
programme.desc: The epic medieval drama based on the novels by Bernard Cornwell continues. Following the battle of Dunholm, Uhtred is serving as lord of the Wessex town of Coccham - but trouble is brewing in nearby East Anglia and Aethelwold brings him news of a prophecy that raises questions of fate and duty for the warrior - and puts him at odds with Gisela. At Winchester, preparations for the royal wedding are under way as Aethelred of Mercia arrives. Beocca confides in Uhtred and is left with an important question to ask.(n)

programme.title: MOTD: The Premier League Show
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents the magazine programme featuring news and action from the Premier League, plus interviews with the country's biggest football stars.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Second Chance Summer: Tuscany
programme.desc: The group begin to settle into rural living after their first week living in Tuscany, but a storm forces them to race against time to complete the ambitious Sangiovese grape harvest, and rescue the farm's biggest income. Meanwhile, the group members look to expand the farm's potential with a new Bed and Breakfast venture, and begin to renovate an empty out-building. However, as the first guests start to arrive, all does not go according to plan, and temperamental Tuscan plumbing puts a spanner in the works for their grand ambitions.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Into the Wind
programme.desc: Writer and birdwatcher Tim Dee walks along the vast open flatlands of the Lincolnshire Wash, on a quest to capture the elusive sound of 'pure' wind. On his travels, he reflects on the landscape, walking, writing, birds and wind. From documentary film maker Richard Alwyn.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Wonderlands: Islands of Evolution
programme.desc: Palaeontologist Richard Fortey investigates why islands are natural laboratories of evolution and examines the unique and remarkable species that live on them. He begins by heading to Hawaii to investigate how life colonises a newly formed island, and encounters honeycreeper birds whose development rivals that of Darwin's famous finches, as well as carnivorous caterpillars that now cannot eat leaves, and giant silversword plants that thrive in parched volcanic soil at heights of 10,000ft.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Conservationist Rom Whitaker discovered a leopard had moved on to his farm near Chennai and decided to investigate India's complex relationship with the big cats and find out why hundreds of the animals are being stoned, trapped or shot. He examines why such a large predator is still relatively common in a country of 1.2 billion people and explores the reasons behind some leopards becoming man-eaters.(n)

programme.title: Dust Storm
programme.desc: Documentary about the dangerous weather phenomena. The programme explores the Middle east, the part of the world most heavily affected by dust storms, and questions what causes them, the damage they can cause to people's health and how they can be prevented.(n)

programme.title: The Big Think
programme.sub-title: Should We Go to Mars? The Big Think.
programme.desc: Dr Kevin Fong, who has a diverse background in astrophysics, aeronautics and medicine, offers a guide through the ethical, technical and scientific challenges of attempting to send astronauts to Mars. Costing billions of dollars, and the lives of those brave enough to attempt it, Kevin asks if the possible benefits are really worth the risk?.(n)

programme.title: Sappho: Love & Life on Lesbos with Margaret Mountford
programme.desc: Documentary following Alan Sugar's former Apprentice adviser as she searches for the truth behind the legend of Sappho, the most controversial writer of the ancient world and the first authentic woman's voice in Western history. The discovery of a lost papyrus containing the words to songs that had not been heard for 1,700 years sends Margaret on a journey of exploration to learn more about the poet whose erotic writings created the words `sapphic' and `lesbian', named after the island of Lesbos - the place of her birth.(n)

programme.title: 1066: A Year to Conquer England
programme.desc: After months trapped in a port in northern France, the winds finally change and Duke William leads his vast invasion fleet across the Channel. Catastrophically, King Harold is 300 miles away in the north, having defeated the Vikings. Harold rushes back south, gathers a new army, and heads to Hastings to take on this new invasion. The two armies will meet at Battle in Sussex on 14 October, 1066, and the outcome will change the shape of England and Europe forever. Dan Snow presents. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Wonderlands: Islands of Evolution
programme.desc: Palaeontologist Richard Fortey investigates why islands are natural laboratories of evolution and examines the unique and remarkable species that live on them. He begins by heading to Hawaii to investigate how life colonises a newly formed island, and encounters honeycreeper birds whose development rivals that of Darwin's famous finches, as well as carnivorous caterpillars that now cannot eat leaves, and giant silversword plants that thrive in parched volcanic soil at heights of 10,000ft.(n)

programme.title: The Bridge: Fifty Years Across the Forth
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating the Forth Road Bridge, one of Scotland's great landmarks and the biggest of its kind when it opened in 1964. The film includes the recollections of those who built the bridge, the memories of former ferry workers and old home-movie footage.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from August 11, with artists including David Grant, Level 42 and Depeche Mode. Presented by Tommy Vance and Richard Skinner.(n)

programme.title: The Bridge: Fifty Years Across the Forth
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating the Forth Road Bridge, one of Scotland's great landmarks and the biggest of its kind when it opened in 1964. The film includes the recollections of those who built the bridge, the memories of former ferry workers and old home-movie footage.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift : Blazes and Brigades - The Story of the Fire Service.
programme.desc: Documentary looking back on nearly two centuries of British firefighting, exploring how major incidents and the evolution of technology from manual pumps to motorised fire engines have helped forge the modern fire service. Featuring interviews with 99-year-old Doug Lightning, the last surviving fireman who served during the Sheffield blitz, and Mary-Joy Langdon, Britain's first female firefighter. Narrated by Kirsty Young.(n)

programme.title: Bucket
programme.desc: New series. Comedy, starring Miriam Margolyes as an eccentric free spirit who, having revealed she is dying, decides to embark on a trip to tick off the items on her bucket list. Frog Stone co-stars as her more reserved daughter, who reluctantly comes along for the ride.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Summer returns, transforming the landscape of the famous national park from a frozen wilderness into the ideal environment for newborn animals. As temperatures rise, grizzly bears teach their young the secrets of survival - but even at this time of year, snow can sweep down from the mountains without warning.(n)

programme.title: The Silk Road
programme.desc: Sam Willis travels through Central Asia. In Tajikistan, he meets the last survivors of the Sogdian people, a culture that proved vital to the success of the Silk Road and traded from the China Sea to the Mediterranean. He also visits the Uzbek cities of Samarkand and Bukhara, discovering how the conqueror Timur captured large numbers of craftsmen to build them, and discovers how trade between nations led to the birth of astronomy and modern mathematics.(n)

programme.title: Aviva Premiership Rugby Highlights
programme.desc: Sarra Elgan presents extended highlights from a huge weekend of Aviva Premiership action, including Saracens v Harlequins, Bath v Leicester Tigers and Wasps v Northampton Saints.(n)

An undiagnosed condition drove a wedge between Sammy and her mum, when her bad behaviour was put down to teenage hormones, until a long-awaited diagnosis of endometriosis when she was 19 enabled them to build bridges.(n)

programme.desc: Kevin McCloud and Anna Keay present the nominees for buildings constructed in the 20th century. Anna takes in Castle Drogo - the last castle built in Britain, Jonathan Foyle loses himself in the art deco glamour of the former Birmingham Central Fire Station, and Marianne Suhr uncovers how a much-loved building in Newcastle has been rescued from the brink. Kevin and Anna then hear which building the judges have put through to the shortlist before the overall winner is revealed. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: The final documentary about the Mormon community meets Chris and Sasha, who have recently moved to Rockland Ranch. Chris's late father was the founder of the community, and he dreams of one day building his own '`family kingdom' with four wives and 50 children, But as the couple decide to approach a potential second wife, unforeseen challenges lie ahead. The Utah State Senate is attempting to make polygamy illegal, forcing the community to rise up and fight for their way of life. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Super Orgasm
programme.desc: For most women multiple orgasms can seem almost mythical. But some can experience it not once, twice or even 10 times, but 60, 70 or 100 - a super-orgasm. In this documentary, a group of these women volunteer for a series of tests in a scientific investigation to reveal the truth behind the super-orgasm. The aim is to measure and record the phenomenon for the first time, finding out how the brain and the body react before, during and after, and asking if these women are wired differently to other people. And if not, is it something that could be learned by anyone?.(n)

However, Dunne tells his lawyer Carrie Clark he was miles away in Falls Church at the time - stabbing bookmaker Donny Sullivan to death. Unable to reveal the truth to the NCIS team, Clark decides to check out the alibi herself. Crime drama, guest starring Salli Richardson-Whitfield (A Town Called Eureka).(n)
